chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become as sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.
items.plainText: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become as sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.

items.text: And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.
items.plainText: And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.

items.text: And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.
items.plainText: And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.

items.text: Charity suffereth long, and is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,
items.plainText: Charity suffereth long, and is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

items.text: Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;
items.plainText: Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;

items.text: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;
items.plainText: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;

items.text: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.
items.plainText: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

items.text: Charity never faileth: but whether there be prophecies, they shall fail; whether there be tongues, they shall cease; whether there be knowledge, it shall vanish away.
items.plainText: Charity never faileth: but whether there be prophecies, they shall fail; whether there be tongues, they shall cease; whether there be knowledge, it shall vanish away.

items.text: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.
items.plainText: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.

items.text: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.
items.plainText: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.

items.text: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.
items.plainText: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.

items.text: For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.
items.plainText: For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.

items.text: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.
items.plainText: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.
